content: Yes, that's true. Range anxiety has always been a concern for many electric car buyers, but with advancements in battery technology, the range of electric cars has greatly improved over the years. As newer models come into the market, their driving range continues to increase. Most newer models of electric cars with an average-sized battery have a range of anywhere from 150 to 300 miles on a single charge, which is generally enough to meet the needs of most drivers. With the increasing demand for electric vehicles, it's likely that manufacturers will continue to develop batteries with longer ranges and faster charging times to keep up with the competition.
